Textual response:
Based on your request, I recommend the "back extension on exercise ball" exercise. This exercise targets the spine and can help improve posture by strengthening the muscles in your back. To perform this exercise, start by lying on an exercise ball with your stomach facing down. Slowly lift your arms, shoulders, and upper back off the ball, keeping your core muscles engaged. Hold for a few seconds, then lower back down. Repeat for 10-15 repetitions.
